meanings.definition: A bitter South American tree bark used in medicine.
meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed a tonic made from quina to help with my fever.
meanings.sent2: The quina bark is known for its medicinal properties in treating malaria.
meanings.sent3: I tried chewing on some quina bark, hoping it would magically cure my cold.
meanings.sent4: The taste of quina bark was so bitter, it felt like swallowing a piece of the rainforest.
meanings.sent5: The quina bark's bitterness lingered in my mouth long after I had taken it.

meanings.definition: A coin of Peru, worth one hundredth of a sol.
meanings.sent1: I found a quina on the street and realized it was a Peruvian coin.
meanings.sent2: In Peru, you can buy small items with just a quina.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally dropped my quina in the fountain, making a wish for more luck.
meanings.sent4: The quina gleamed under the sunlight, catching the eye of passersby.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the quina hitting the pavement echoed through the quiet street.

meanings.definition: A unit of currency in Brazil, equal to one hundredth of a real.
meanings.sent1: I exchanged my dollars for some quinas to use during my trip to Brazil.
meanings.sent2: The price of the souvenir was just a few quinas, making it affordable.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally paid with a quina instead of a real, causing confusion at the market.
meanings.sent4: The quina jingled in my pocket, a reminder of the vibrant markets in Brazil.
meanings.sent5: The colorful quinas added a touch of Brazil to my coin collection.
